quote.text: Each one has to find his peace from within. And peace to be real must be unaffected by outside circumstances.
quote.author: Ghandi

quote.text: Peace is its own reward.
quote.author: Ghandi

quote.text: I object to violence because when it appears to do good, the good is only temporary; the evil it does is permanent.
quote.author: Ghandi

quote.text: There is nothing that wastes the body like worry, and one who has any faith in God should be ashamed to worry about anything whatsoever.
quote.author: Ghandi

quote.text:
The roots of Violence:
Wealth without work,
Pleasure without conscience,
Knowledge without character,
Commerce without morality,
Science without humanity,
Worship without sacrifice,
Politics without principles.
quote.author: Ghandi

quote.text: When I despair, I remember that all through history the ways of truth and love have always won. There have been tyrants and murderers, and for a time they can seem invincible, but in the end they always fall. Think of it - always.
quote.author: Ghandi

quote.text: Non-violence is a weapon of the strong.
quote.author: Ghandi

quote.text: Victory attained by violence is tantamount to a defeat, for it is momentary.
quote.author: Ghandi

quote.text: No power on earth can subjugate you when you are armed with the sword of ahimsa. It ennobles both the victor and the vanquished.
quote.author: Ghandi

quote.text: An eye for an eye only ends up making the whole world blind.
quote.author: Ghandi

quote.text: You can chain me, you can torture me, you can even destroy this body, but you will never imprison my mind.
quote.author: Ghandi

quote.text: Be the change you want to see in the world.
quote.author: Ghandi

quote.text: Whenever you are confronted with an opponent, conquer him with love.
quote.author: Ghandi

quote.text: Nobody can hurt me without my permission.
quote.author: Ghandi

quote.text: The best way to find yourself is in the service of others.
quote.author: Ghandi

quote.text: There is more to life than increasing its speed.
quote.author: Ghandi

quote.text: Love is the strongest force the world possesses, and yet it is the humblest imaginable.
quote.author: Ghandi

quote.text: You must not lose faith in humanity. Humanity is an ocean; if a few drops of the ocean are dirty, the ocean does not become dirty.
quote.author: Ghandi
quote.reference: Gandhi : His Life and Message for the World (1954), by Louis Fischer, p.177

quote.text: Always aim at complete harmony of thought and word and deed. Always aim at purifying your thoughts and everything will be well.
quote.author: Ghandi

quote.text: As long as you derive inner help and comfort from anything, keep it.
quote.author: Ghandi

quote.text: Our life is a long and arduous quest after Truth.
quote.author: Ghandi

quote.text: To call woman the weaker sex is a libel; it is man's injustice to woman.
quote.author: Ghandi

quote.text: It is beyond my power to induce in you a belief in God. There are certain things which are self proved and certain which are not proved at all. The existence of God is like a geometrical axiom. It may be beyond our heart grasp. I shall not talk of an intellectual grasp. Intellectual attempts are more or less failures, as a rational explanation cannot give you the faith in a living God. For it is a thing beyond the grasp of reason. It transcends reason. There are numerous phenomena from which you can reason out the existence of God, but I shall not insult your intelligence by offering you a rational explanation of that type. I would have you brush aside all rational explanations and begin with a simple childlike faith in God. If I exist, God exists. With me it is a necessity of my being as it is with millions. They may not be able to talk about it, but from their life you can see that it is a part of their life. I am only asking you to restore the belief that has been undermined. In order to do so, you have to unlearn a lot of literature that dazzles your intelligence and throws you off your feet. Start with the faith which is also a token of humility and an admission that we know nothing, that we are less than atoms in this universe. We are less than atoms, I say, because the atom obeys the law of its being, whereas we in the insolence of our ignorance deny the law of nature. But I have no argument to address to those who have no faith.
quote.author: Ghandi

quote.text: I worship God as Truth only. I have not yet found Him, but I am seeking after Him.
quote.author: Ghandi

quote.text: It is unwise to be too sure of one's own wisdom. It is healthy to be reminded that the strongest might weaken and the wisest might err.
quote.author: Ghandi

quote.text: Religions are different roads converging to the same point. What does it matter that we take different road, so long as we reach the same goal. Wherein is the cause for quarreling?
quote.author: Ghandi

quote.text: Truth never damages a cause that is just.
quote.author: Ghandi

quote.text: Truth alone will endure, all the rest will be swept away before the tide of time.
quote.author: Ghandi

quote.text: Supplication, worship, prayer are no superstition; they are acts more real than the acts of eating, drinking, sitting or walking. It is no exaggeration to say that they alone are real, all else is unreal.
quote.author: Ghandi
quote.reference: Part I, Chapter 21, 'Nirbal Ke Bala Rama'
